result.execSummary:
The defendant Najuan L Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
Concurrent with: Count 6
Consecutive to: any other current sentence

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution for Kohls $349.00 (resulting from Count 2), Walmart $361.76 (resulting from Count 3), Kohls $220.00 (resulting from Count 5), Walmart $599.98 (resulting from Count 6) and Roundy's $1002.98 (Resulting from Counts 7 and 8) to be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

Court costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent

Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by agent

No contact with Victims, businesses and co-defendant listed in the criminal complaint

AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended

Absolute sobriety, random UA's

No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia

No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid doctor's prescription

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Sentencing hearing on September 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.
filed, to be produced from Jackson Correctional for the 9/26/2022 sentencing hearing.

11:17 AM; Case called for Jury status hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Najuan L Brown in court, in custody at WCJ (on OTP from Jackson Correctional).  Attorney Daniel G. Mitchell in court for Najuan L Brown.  Court notes a plea questionnaire has been filed and recites the offer as listed on the plea questionnaire.  State and Atty. Mitchell confirm the offer as recited on the record.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 2, 4 & 6, Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 2, 4 & 6.  Court orders Counts 1, 3, 5 & 7-8 dismissed and read in.  Atty. Mitchell presents statements and is requesting the matter be set over for sentencing.  No objection from the State.  Court will cancel the 8/16/2022 jury trial and based on the defendant entering his plea today will find the Prompt disposition request has been withdrawn.  Court will order the defendant be returned to Jackson Correctional.  Court will adjourn for sentencing.  Defendant to be produced from Jackson Correctional for the next court date.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Filed by the State
State's Proposed Jury Instructions filed.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
AMENDED Witness List filed by the State
filed, to be produced from Jackson Correctional Institution for the 8/11/2022 Jury status and 8/16/2022 Jury trial.

Jury status hearing on August 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

08:40 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Najuan L Brown in court by Zoom video means, in custody at Jackson Correctional, with attorney Daniel G. Mitchell.   Alyssa M Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Atty. Mitchell provides an update, he notes his client filed a request for prompt disposition and is requesting the matter be set for trial accordingly.  Court notes the State did file a letter on 5/17/2022 noting they received the prompt disposition request from the defendant on 4/21/2022.  Court notes based on the filing date this matter would need to be set for trial by 8/19/2022.  State confirms.  Court will schedule the matter accordingly for jury status and jury trial based on the Prompy Disposition request.  Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Jackson Correctional for the next court date.  Defendant notes that he previously signed a signature bond but is asking the bail be modified.  Court advises the defendant to contact his attorney about having a motion to modify bail filed; Court will take no further action at this time with regards to bail.  Jury status hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

08:39 AM Defendant Najuan L Brown in court, in custody, with attorney Daniel G. Mitchell.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Village of Menomonee Falls police officer Lucas Kuehne sworn and testified on direct by Atty. Nickolie.  Cross examination by Atty. Mitchell.  City of New Berlin detective, Scott Schmit sworn and testified on direct by Atty. Nickolie.  Former City of Brookfield, police officer, Cindy Boyadjian sworn and testified on direct by Atty. Nickolie.  State rests.  Testimony closed.  Atty. Nickolie moves for bind over.  Atty. Mitchell moves to dismiss.    Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Atty. Mitchell states the defendant has filed a detainer and requests the first possible date for the next hearing.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 3, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Prompt Dispo Request to schedule Preliminary Hearing.

10:05 AM Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Najuan L Brown in court by telephone means, in custody at Jackson Correctional Institution, with attorney Daniel G. Mitchell by zoom video.  Attorney Mitchell states he has not yet had an opportunity to meet with his client but will set up time soon to speak about a preliminary hearing.  The Court will set this matter for a status date to give Attorney Mitchell time to meet and speak to the defendant if he would like a hearing or a potential waiver.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Clerk's office to set up video appearance from Jackson Correctional for the next date.  The Court will allow attorney Mitchell to appear by zoom for the status date.  Hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
appointing Attorney Daniel Mitchell

10:07 AM Defendant Najuan L Brown appeared by Zoom, in custody, from Jackson Correctional.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Alyssa Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Clerk of Court to notify Public Defender's Office to evaluate defendant.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Bail remains as fixed.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  The defendant to appear by Zoom from Jackson Correctional at the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on May 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Fax Confirmation
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with businesses listed in the Criminal Complaint.

03:00 PM Defendant Najuan L Brown in court by zoom video, in custody Jackson Correctional.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin in person.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Defendant in custody until May 24, 2024.  Clerk's office to notify the public defender's office to send him the information.  Hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on April 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
